personalInfo.name: Chouaeb Rahal
personalInfo.title: Junior Network Administrator
personalInfo.bio: Dedicated and detail-oriented Junior Network Administrator with a strong foundation in network configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting. Proven ability to support and optimize network performance, ensuring high availability and security. Eager to apply technical skills and a passion for problem-solving to contribute to a dynamic IT team and support business objectives. Welcome to my online portfolio. Check out my latest projects and case studies.

projects.title: Volutpat App
projects.description: You can link to your project Github page.

projects.title: University Network Project
projects.shortDescription: Designed and configured a multi-campus university network with VLANs, RIP v2 routing, static routes, and network services.
projects.fullDescription: A Cisco Packet Tracer project simulating the network of a university with two campuses and four faculties. Implemented VLANs for departments, RIP v2 routing with static routes for external servers, DHCP for dynamic IP allocation, and deployed web and mail servers. Ensured reliable end-to-end connectivity and network segmentation across administrative offices and student labs.

projects.title: Hotel Network Project
projects.shortDescription: Developed a three-floor hotel network with VLANs, OSPF routing, DHCP, SSH access, and port security.
projects.fullDescription: Designed and implemented a Cisco Packet Tracer project for a hotel network with multiple departments across three floors. Configured VLANs per department, OSPF routing across three routers, DHCP server for IP allocation, SSH for secure remote access, and port security on switches. Provided reliable connectivity, network segmentation, and enhanced security.

projects.title: Master Thesis Project - Secure Time Synchronization
projects.shortDescription: Enhanced the security of time synchronization protocols using anomaly detection methods.
projects.fullDescription: Final-year academic project for Master’s degree. Analyzed vulnerabilities in time synchronization protocols, proposed an anomaly detection method to identify malicious or faulty nodes, and validated improvements through simulation. Focused on improving the robustness and reliability of distributed systems synchronization.

projects.title: E-commerce Website
projects.shortDescription: Developed a simple e-commerce platform as part of Bachelor’s degree coursework.
projects.fullDescription: Academic project completed during Bachelor’s studies. Built a basic e-commerce website with product management, shopping cart, and user authentication features. Strengthened knowledge of web technologies and full-stack development fundamentals.

testimonials.text: Chouaib delivered exceptional work on our mobile banking application. His attention to detail and technical expertise made our project a huge success.
